Title: Object: The Great Egyptian Gun
Object: The Volunteers of England
Description: A broadside on the Volunteer companies, set up when the war between Britain and France resumed in 1803; with a wood-engraving showing a profile of a cannon which was captured from the French during the battle in Egypt on 21 March 1801; and with letterpress title, one paragraph of text, and verses of a song in two columns. (London, T Kaygill; 1803)
Curator's comments: The French Revolutionary Wars (1792-1802) formally ended with the Peace of Amiens on 27 March 1802. In May 1803 the war resumed between France and Britain because of France's interference in Italian and Swiss affairs, and Britain's refusal to return Malta to the Knights of Malta. This marked the begining of the Napoleonic Wars (1803-1815) The verses were to be sung to the air of "Success to the Duchess wherever she goes".
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
